document.docAuthor: Ramalho, Laís V., Taylor, Paul D., Moraes, Fernando Coreixas, Moura, Rodrigo, Amado-Filho, Gilberto M. & Bastos, Alex C.
document.masterDocTitle: Bryozoan framework composition in the oddly shaped reefs from Abrolhos Bank, Brazil, southwestern Atlantic: taxonomy and ecology

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bryozoan framework composition in the oddly shaped reefs from Abrolhos Bank, Brazil, southwestern Atlantic: taxonomy and ecology

taxonomicName.emphasis: Metrarabdotos aff. jani Winston, Vieira & Woollacott, 2014

subSubSection.paragraph:
aff.
Metrarabdotos jani
Winston et al. , 2014
: p. 198, fig. 38.

materialsCitation.collectorName: Parcel dos Abrolhos & R. Moura. & Moura. G. & A. Bastos.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Material examined.
Abrolhos Bank , Bahia State, Brazil : MNRJ-Bry1345, Parcel dos Abrolhos ,
4 m
depth,
February 2014
, col.
R. Moura.
G. Amado-Filho & A. Bastos.

subSubSection.paragraph: Short description. Fragments of encrusting colonies with zooids disposed quincuncially. Frontal wall tuberculate with large and almost circular areolar pores. Secondary orifice circular with a small U-shaped sinus; a simple, elongated and curved avicularium present lateral to the orifice. Ovicell not observed.

Remarks.
Winston et al . (2014)
described
Metrarabdotos jani
from Rio de Janeiro State and mentioned two characteristic features of the ovicell: the absence of pores on the ooecial surface and the presence of more than a single line of areolar pores. The specimens from Abrolhos are very similar to
M. jani
but no ovicells have been observed. Since the main diagnostic taxonomic features are the ovicells, we identify the studied material as
M. aff. jani
.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 1. Bryozoan species list from Abrolhos Bank, Brazil, with the distribution and frequency of the 20 species recorded along the three depths sampled from drill cores. I: inside the core; E: external on the surface of the core; Bold = new species and/or new record for Abrolhos Bank; * species record needs re-examination (from Almeida et al . 2015a); # new data from vouchers deposited in the Bryozoan Collection at Museu Nacional-UFRJ.
